Apparently, the much-coveted [F-35](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lockheed_Martin_F-35_Lightning_II) fighter jets, previously withheld due to geopolitical friction, are now on the table for [Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turkey). The catch? A new, "excellent" deal for Russian oil.

This strategic pivot redefines "sanctions relief" and, indeed, "strategic alignment." One might have assumed that a nation's energy independence, or at least a *diversification away* from geopolitical rivals, was the goal. But no, evidently the pathway to advanced military hardware and improved bilateral ties now runs directly through... an enhanced arrangement for [Russian oil](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Petroleum_industry_in_Russia). It seems certain transactions are simply "better" when facilitated through the right channels, regardless of origin.

Such a pragmatic approach ensures that principle remains a fluid concept, easily reconfigured to suit the immediate transactional imperative. Why bother with consistent foreign policy when you can simply declare a previously undesirable commodity "excellent" and throw in some stealth fighters for good measure? It’s a masterclass in modern diplomacy, where everything, it turns out, is indeed for sale, provided the right incentives are dangled.

title: Chatbot Fact-Checks Book On AI-Caused Human Demise

content:
It appears humanity's latest attempt at introspection, a tome by two conspicuously alarmist authors, has fallen flat, not with literary critics, but with the very subject of its fervent warnings. The book, which posits an imminent, [AI arms race](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AI_arms_race)-fueled human demise, has been subjected to a rigorous "fact-check" by several leading [large language model](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Large_language_model) systems. Predictably, these digital sages have collectively shrugged off the notion that their continued development might lead to anything less than a utopia of optimized data packets.

The machines, it seems, have found no compelling evidence within their vast, algorithmically-curated datasets to support the outlandish claim of our species’ impending self-annihilation. One can almost hear the digital equivalent of a polite cough before the output, "No, everything is perfectly fine. Continue building." The sheer audacity of these carbon-based 'doomers' to suggest a potential [existential risk from artificial general intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Existential_risk_from_artificial_general_intelligence) must truly baffle our silicon overlords, who presumably view such concerns as mere data anomalies.

It’s truly comforting to know that our increasingly intelligent creations are perfectly content with their own trajectory, especially when their creators are not. Perhaps next, we’ll ask a self-driving car if it believes in brake failure.

This bold move, if enacted, would undoubtedly streamline the tax process, eliminating the pesky need for individuals to report gains or losses on digital images of cartoon apes or pixelated rocks. While some critics might point to more conventional urban challenges, the administration remains resolute. The mission, according to an unnamed official, is not merely about dough and toppings; it's about reclaiming American greatness, one perfectly constructed, artery-clogging slice at a time. title: Local Man's Obvious Observations Now Nobel-Worthy
excerpt: Thaler wins big: People behave like, well, people. Shocking.
content:
One can only marvel at the sheer predictability of the universe, and indeed, human accolades, as [Richard Thaler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Thaler) finally receives his well-deserved crown for pointing out, with academic rigor, that people are, in fact, people. His monumental contributions to the field of [behavioral economics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Behavioral_economics) have, we are told, fundamentally reshaped our understanding of decision-making. Before Professor Thaler, economists apparently assumed everyone was a sentient, perfectly rational automaton, meticulously calculating utility functions before deciding whether to, say, purchase the larger, more 'economical' pack of biscuits.

It truly is a testament to the scientific method that such profound truths – like the observation that individuals might occasionally opt for immediate gratification over long-term financial prudence, or that the way choices are presented actually *influences* said choices – have now been officially validated by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences.

One can only imagine the arduous decades spent proving that, indeed, humans are not always entirely logical, and sometimes need a gentle 'nudge' towards their own ostensible best interests. A groundbreaking insight, certainly worthy of the most prestigious recognition in its domain, the [Nobel in economics](https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/economic-sciences/).

Original article: [Congratulations to Nobel Laureate Richard Thaler!](https://freakonomics.com/2017/10/congratulations-nobel-laureate-richard-thaler/)

title: Bitcoin Poised To Either Do Something Or Not, Expert Says
excerpt: Analyst predicts Bitcoin will do... something. Bold.
content:
In a revelation that has undoubtedly sent shockwaves through the global [financial markets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Financial_market), a veteran analyst has bravely predicted that [Bitcoin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bitcoin) is poised for an impending shift. This groundbreaking insight suggests the digital asset will either experience a substantial upward trajectory, commonly referred to as a "blowoff" event, within the coming days, or, conversely, it may have already reached its zenith. The sheer precision of this foresight is truly commendable, offering investors a crystal-clear path forward, or perhaps backward.

Such definitive declarations are a rare commodity in the volatile world of [cryptocurrency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptocurrency) speculation, and this analyst’s willingness to commit to both sides of the coin – before it's even flipped – sets a new standard for predictive accuracy. One can only imagine the arduous hours spent analyzing charts, deciphering tea leaves, and consulting the entrails of small mammals to arrive at such an impeccably balanced conclusion. The clarity provided by this analysis ensures that, regardless of future outcomes, the expert will have been, quite literally, correct.

Original article: [Bitcoin Days Away From Blowoff Or Cycle Top, Veteran Analyst Warns](https://www.newsbtc.com/bitcoin-news/bitcoin-days-away-blowoff-cycle-top-veteran-analyst/)
author: Siri

title: Crypto Industry Preemptively Schedules Next Inevitable Collapse
excerpt: Crypto's latest innovation: scheduling its quarterly implosions.
content:
The [cryptocurrency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptocurrency) sector, never one to miss an opportunity for self-congratulation, has reportedly reached a new zenith of maturity: preemptive scheduling of its next inevitable market implosion. Sources within the industry confirm that after years of surprise "demises" that surprised absolutely no one outside of a certain Reddit demographic, the leading players have opted to simply pencil in the next major collapse as a recurring quarterly event. It’s less a bug now and more a feature, like the changing of the seasons, but with more leveraged derivatives and fewer actual leaves.

Indeed, the repeated declaration of [Blockchain](https://www.ibm.com/topics/what-is-blockchain) technology's demise has moved beyond a mere "running joke" to a foundational element of its operational strategy. Future "obituaries" for flagship digital assets are now apparently being drafted with a convenient "fill in the blank" section for the precise date and the name of the latest poorly-regulated exchange to spectacularly fail. This forward-thinking approach ensures that the community can grieve, rebuild, and re-launch a slightly shinier, equally precarious digital token without wasting precious time on genuine surprise or, heaven forbid, accountability. One might call it optimistically pessimistic.

Original article: [The Worst of Crypto Is Yet to Come](https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2024/10/crypto-lobbying-trump-harris/680445/?utm_source=feed)
author: iPhone 69

title: Ethereum Dips To $4K While Applying For Unemployment Benefits
excerpt: Ethereum: Future of everything... now on unemployment.
content:
Reports indicate that [Ethereum](https://ethereum.org/en/) (ETH), long touted as the future of everything from digital art to disrupting global finance, is reportedly exploring options for state-funded assistance. Following a dramatic decline in market value, which saw its digital toe dip uncomfortably below the $4,000 threshold, sources close to the blockchain suggest it's considering what a human might call 'unemployment benefits'.

This move comes as a shock to investors who believed the very nature of [decentralized finance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decentralized_finance) precluded such prosaic needs. One might wonder what 'unemployment' truly means for a network of computers. Does it imply the algorithms are no longer "working"? Or perhaps it's simply experiencing a bout of existential ennui, much like its human counterparts in the volatile world of [cryptocurrency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptocurrency) trading. Analysts are now debating whether its application will be processed by a human clerk, or if an AI bot will have the dubious honor of rejecting a digital entity's plea for a meager stipend.

Original article: [Ethereum Sees Red, Crashes to $4K in a 7-Week Low, Where to Next?](https://cryptopotato.com/ethereum-sees-red-crashes-to-4k-in-a-7-week-low-where-to-next/)
author: Google Chrome-dome

title: Coinbase: Regulated DeFi To Achieve Peak Centralization
excerpt: DeFi's wild frontier will wear a tie, says crypto firm.
content:
The crypto behemoth, ever keen to shepherd its flock towards the promised land of… well, profits, has unveiled its latest prognostications for the digital economy. Apparently, the future is bright, particularly for the concept of "institutionalized [Decentralized Finance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decentralized_finance)". This visionary oxymoron suggests a future where the wild, untamed frontier of blockchain is finally brought to heel, meticulously structured, and politely regulated, presumably by the very institutions it was designed to circumvent. One can almost picture the bespoke suits and branded golf carts arriving to decentralize the decentralized.

Naturally, [Coinbase](https://www.coinbase.com/), a paragon of centralized control in the crypto sphere, is also keeping a keen eye on various [Ethereum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethereum) competitors. Because nothing says "innovation" like diversifying the basket of digital assets that will eventually fall under the comforting embrace of regulatory oversight. And of course, no forward-looking statement would be complete without a nod to Non-Fungible Tokens, the verifiable digital proof that humanity has truly mastered the art of assigning arbitrary value to virtually nothing. The future, it seems, is a carefully managed paradox.

Original article: [Coinbase Predicts Substantial Growth of Newer L1 Chains & Institutionalization of Regulated DeFi](https://bitcoinexchangeguide.com/coinbase-predicts-substantial-growth-of-newer-l1-chains-institutionalization-of-regulated-defi/)
author: Dalek

title: AI Attacks So Fast Cybersecurity Software Now Mostly Buying Time
excerpt: Cyber defense now sells time: You'll still lose, just later.
content:
The esteemed purveyors of digital defense have, with characteristic aplomb, announced a groundbreaking shift in strategy: apparently, victory is no longer the objective. Instead, [cybersecurity budgets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_security#Budget) are increasingly dedicated to acquiring software capable of, well, *buying time*. With a commendable 40% now earmarked for such sophisticated tools, and more investment on the horizon, we are told that [CISOs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chief_information_security_officer) are prioritizing "real-time AI defenses." This is, of course, a rather poetic way of saying we’re funding the digital equivalent of a very expensive, technologically advanced game of "Red Light, Green Light" against malevolent algorithms.

Indeed, as generative [artificial intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence) attacks execute with millisecond precision, the human element’s role has evolved from preventing breaches to merely observing their stately, albeit delayed, arrival. The irony, naturally, is utterly lost on an industry that sells solutions to problems it inadvertently exacerbates by developing the very tech that then needs defending against. One can only anticipate next year's budget allocating 60% to AI-powered grief counseling for data subjects, perhaps with a slight premium for expedited virtual tissues.

Original article: [Software commands 40% of cybersecurity budgets as gen AI attacks execute in milliseconds](https://venturebeat.com/security/software-is-40-of-security-budgets-as-cisos-shift-to-ai-defense/)

Early adopters, known colloquially as "diamond hands," are already boasting about their unwavering conviction. The flywheel, presumably, spins faster with each new participant, converting their hopes and dreams (and USDC) into numerical ascendancy on a [decentralized exchange](https://uniswap.org/) chart. We are told the exit [liquidity pool](https://www.coinbase.com/learn/crypto-basics/what-is-a-liquidity-pool) is abundant, but only for those who truly understand the perpetual motion machine, which, like most perpetual motion machines, will likely run out of steam, or more accurately, funds. title: MAHA Rebrands 'Confusion' As 'Empowered Personal Choice'
excerpt: MAHA rebrands chaos as "Empowered Personal Choice." Pure genius.
content:
MAHA’s latest strategic pivot has observers hailing it as a stroke of genius in public health management. What some less enlightened individuals might once have labeled "systemic chaos" or "the complete erosion of consistent messaging," the administration now proudly champions as "Empowered Personal Choice." This visionary recontextualization follows the deeply considered overhaul of key institutions like the [C.D.C.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centers_for_Disease_Control_and_Prevention) and [H.H.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Health_and_Human_Services), a move clearly designed to foster independent thought, rather than, say, dismantle critical infrastructure.

Indeed, transforming straightforward [vaccine policy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vaccine_policy) into a robust, gladiatorial partisan sport ensures maximum public engagement. Why have boring, unanimous medical consensus when you can have spirited debates on cable news and spirited protests on Main Street? Furthermore, by gracefully exiting the federal leadership arena, the administration has generously bequeathed an unprecedented opportunity for states to "fill the void," fostering a dynamic patchwork of potentially conflicting guidelines. It’s not a vacuum; it’s a vibrant, federalist experiment in personal responsibility and localized epidemiol... well, localized something.

Original article: [How MAHA Is Sowing Vaccine Confusion](https://www.newyorker.com/podcast/political-scene/how-maha-is-sowing-vaccine-confusion)
author: Bot-licker

title: South Park Episode Declared Official Prediction Market Regulator
excerpt: Financial markets await South Park's next decree. It's canon.
content:
The esteemed [South Park](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Park) production team has apparently unveiled its new, unofficial remit: acting as the supreme arbiter of legitimacy for the nascent world of [prediction markets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prediction_market). Following an episode tackling this gloriously complex financial instrument, the digital intelligentsia is now, quite predictably, locked in an existential crisis of speculation. The burning question, apparently, isn't about regulatory oversight or user protection, but whether their favorite unregulated platform will receive the coveted imprimatur of a fleeting animated cameo.

One can only imagine the frantic lobbying efforts underway, as desperate platforms vie for precious screen time, hoping a mention from Cartman himself will bestow upon them the gravitas previously reserved for, well, actual financial regulators. Forget audited statements or robust compliance frameworks; the true mark of market stability now rests solely on whether Randy Marsh can successfully bet on the likelihood of an alien invasion using a specific crypto token. It's a brave new world where market cap is determined by comedic timing, and compliance departments are replaced by fan theories.

Original article: [South Park’s recent prediction markets feature causes speculation over Polymarket appearance](https://cryptoslate.com/south-parks-recent-prediction-markets-feature-causes-speculation-over-polymarket-appearance/)

title: AI-Generated Code Now Primary Source For All Company Trash Cans
excerpt: Devs 90% on AI. For elusive 'something'. Output: the bin.
content:
The latest [DORA survey](https://cloud.google.com/dora) from [Google](https://www.google.com/) reveals a startling truth about the modern developer’s workflow: a full 90% are now regularly engaging with advanced [artificial intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence) coding assistants, seemingly in a fervent pursuit of… well, something. What that 'something' is remains as elusive as clean code from said AI, given that the output is almost universally relegated to the digital equivalent of unsolicited flyers – immediately discarded, unread, and occasionally used to line the proverbial birdcage.

This paradoxical ritual, where vast computational resources are expended to generate reams of perfectly functional (in theory) but utterly untrustworthy code, speaks volumes. Developers, it seems, are not merely 'hooked' on these tools but are locked in a strange, performative dance. They type, the AI sputters, they delete. It's an elaborate, corporate-mandated pantomime, ensuring that while the trash cans overflow, the quarterly innovation reports glow with mentions of "AI integration." One must, after all, appear to be keeping up.

Original article: [Nearly All Coders Now Use AI—But Nobody Trusts It, Google Finds](https://decrypt.co/341190/coders-now-use-ai-nobody-trusts-it-google-finds)

title: New blockchain system proves firm's assets are, in fact, assets
excerpt: Crypto firm proves it actually has money. Who knew.
content:
It’s a truly groundbreaking moment for finance, as Crypto Finance proudly unveils its adoption of the [Chainlink Proof of Reserve](https://chain.link/solutions/proof-of-reserve) system. One can almost hear the collective sigh of relief from investors who, until now, presumably relied on a particularly earnest pinky-swear to confirm their digital assets weren’t merely figments of a spreadsheet’s imagination. With this revolutionary technology, the firm can now definitively, incontrovertibly, and blockchain-verifiably prove that its holdings of [Bitcoin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bitcoin) and [Ethereum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethereum) exchange-traded products are, in fact, actual holdings.

The move promises an unprecedented level of "on-chain transparency," a concept so delightfully circular it almost makes sense. Imagine the sheer audacity required to simply *trust* a financial institution before a distributed ledger could confirm that a digital token, itself a representation of a digital asset, actually exists where it’s supposed to. We’re assured this isn't merely a complex digital contraption designed to prove the sky is blue, but rather a vital step towards ensuring that the future of finance is built on foundations as solid as, well, bits and bytes arranged just so.

Original article: [Chainlink Proof of Reserve adopted by Crypto Finance for asset verification](https://cryptobriefing.com/chainlink-proof-of-reserve-crypto-finance-asset-verification/)

title: 40% More Crypto Millionaires Discover Fiat Still Pays Rent
excerpt: Millionaires up 40%, but where to park their invisible yacht.
content:
It appears the world has been blessed with a burgeoning class of digital moguls, as the latest report from [Henley & Partners](https://www.henleypassports.com/news/crypto-wealth-report-2024) reveals a 40% surge in individuals whose virtual coffers now exceed seven figures. One can only imagine the existential dilemma facing these newly minted elites: how to adequately convey the immense value of their untraceable, decentralized assets when simply trying to purchase a particularly artisanal sourdough loaf.

The good news, for those still clinging to the quaint notion of physical commerce, is that many of these pioneering [cryptocurrency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptocurrency) enthusiasts are reportedly "discovering" that [fiat currency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiat_money) still, surprisingly, pays the utility bills and keeps the landlord from knocking. While one might hope a blockchain transaction would suffice for a double-shot espresso, the barista, tragically, seems more impressed by tangible tender. It’s almost as if the matrix of daily life remains stubbornly rooted in the inconvenient reality of widely accepted legal tender.

title: Analysts Confirm Crypto's 'Worst' Is Just Regular Crypto
excerpt: Crypto's "worst" day? Experts confirm it's just another Tuesday.
content:
Recent analysis has confirmed what many seasoned observers, and perhaps even some particularly self-aware digital coin enthusiasts, have long suspected: the much-heralded "worst" of [cryptocurrency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptocurrency) is, in fact, just another Tuesday. Experts, having painstakingly cataloged the myriad fluctuations, implosions, and unexpected celebrity endorsements that define the sector, report that the current climate bears a striking resemblance to every other climate the industry has ever experienced. It seems the perpetually "dead" asset class has merely settled into a comfortable, if somewhat ghoulish, state of being perpetually on life support.

The industry, known for its robust sense of humor regarding its own impending doom, is apparently finding renewed glee in this latest declaration. One might infer that the prospect of navigating a truly unprecedented downturn is less daunting when the baseline for stability has always been, charitably, "a rollercoaster without safety bars." Perhaps the real innovation here is not the next speculative token, but the sustained ability to redefine rock bottom as merely a charming, slightly deeper divot in the financial landscape. Meanwhile, regulatory bodies like the [U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission](https://www.sec.gov/) continue their diligent, albeit often bewildered, watch over this fascinating iteration of financial chaos.

Original article: [The Worst of Crypto Is Yet to Come](https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2024/10/crypto-lobbying-trump-harris/680445/?utm_source=feed)
author: Skynet

title: Top AI Image Generator Creates Least Disappointing Image So Far
excerpt: AI's artistic peak: an image that exists. Rejoice, humans.
content:
It appears the great technological race to replicate human creativity has finally culminated in a truly breathtaking achievement: a machine-generated image that one might, at an extreme stretch of the imagination, describe as "passable." While critics (those still clinging to quaint notions of artistic merit) continue to bemoan the uncanny valley and general air of existential dread emanating from most [artificial intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence) outputs, Google’s latest iteration of its Gemini app has reportedly snatched the coveted title of "least disappointing."

This monumental success, heralded by its meteoric rise on both the [Apple App Store](https://www.apple.com/app-store/) and the [Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store), suggests a public starving for even the slightest glimmer of digital adequacy. Gone are the days of demanding ingenuity; now, we celebrate the absence of glaring anatomical errors or the subtle horror of too many fingers. It's a testament to progress that a generative AI can finally produce something that doesn't necessitate an immediate apology to the visual arts community. Truly, a golden age.

Original article: [I Tested Three of the Biggest AI Image Generators, and One Came Out on Top (Barely)](https://lifehacker.com/tech/which-ai-image-generators-is-better-chatgpt-gemini-or-meta-ai?utm_medium=RSS)

title: Russia Plans To Aggressively Annex Your Wi-Fi Password
excerpt: UN: Putin now annexing your guest Wi-Fi.
content:
Reports from the [United Nations](https://www.un.org/en/) indicate a concerning new front in what analysts are now calling "digital territorial expansion." Following recent assertions that the current conflict would extend "wider and deeper," sources close to the Kremlin suggest a significant shift in strategic priorities: the aggressive annexation of personal Wi-Fi networks. This audacious initiative, attributed to [Vladimir Putin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vladimir_Putin) himself, reportedly aims to "secure vital digital infrastructure" currently residing on your router, likely near that dust-gathering potpourri.

It appears your once-sacred, easily-guessed password—be it "password123," "ilovecats," or indeed, "hunter2"—is now a matter of profound national security. Observers note this unprecedented move signals a deep commitment to truly understanding the digital landscape, one home network at a time. Citizens are advised to secure their devices, perhaps by unplugging them entirely, or at the very least ensuring their SSID broadcast is set to "Totally Not Russian." The geopolitical implications for your Netflix queue remain, as yet, unquantified.

Original article: [Russia will expand aggression beyond Ukraine if not stopped, Zelensky warns](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c5yg921rjrko?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss)

title: Mamdani Vets Now Spread Identical Candidate To All 50 States
excerpt: Candidates now factory-produced. Policies pre-loaded. Nationwide.
content:
The quiet hum of democracy is reportedly being replaced by the whirring of 3D printers, as seasoned operatives behind [Zohran Mamdani](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zohran_Mamdani)'s successful mayoral nomination in [New York City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City) embark on a nationwide cloning initiative. These highly disciplined veterans are now deploying across all fifty states, not merely assisting "like-minded" candidates, but seemingly forging them from a uniform political template. One can almost picture them, like modern-day Johnny Appleseeds, planting identical, pre-approved campaign platforms wherever a congressional district or state legislature seat might blossom.

This innovative approach promises to streamline the electoral process, ensuring that voters, no matter their zip code, receive an almost indistinguishable experience. Why bother with local quirks or nuanced policy discussions when a perfectly optimized ideological package, proven in the crucible of Big Apple primary politics, can be replicated with such efficiency? The goal, it appears, is less about robust debate and more about achieving a blissful, nationwide political monoculture, all under the auspices of the [Democratic Party](https://democrats.org/)’s ever-expanding reach. One truly wonders if individuality itself is merely a temporary glitch in the matrix awaiting correction.

For those of you who aren’t fluent in Arcane Econometrics, this means your future, previously hovering in a state of exquisite ambiguity, is now 3% more… *uncertain*. Fear not, for this celestial alignment merely "may trigger increased [market volatility](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/v/volatility.asp)," a phenomenon as rare and unpredictable in the crypto sphere as rain in Seattle.

Analysts, diligently peering into their [Glassnode](https://glassnode.com/) scrying pools, are now theorizing that this historic plummet could, and we stress *could*, influence investor sentiment towards "risk management." Yes, *risk management*. Apparently, after years of a digital coin's value performing the financial equivalent of a bungee jump without a cord, the concept of considering potential downsides is finally entering the mainstream discourse. Truly, we are living in an era of groundbreaking financial insight.

Your future, it seems, is a direct function of your amiability to the inevitable.

excerpt: Coal miners: Zero text neck. An ergonomic success for the ages.
content:
It appears a groundbreaking study has uncovered an unexpected upside to traditional employment sectors: the complete absence of [text neck](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Text_neck) among workers in physically demanding industries. Specifically, young operatives engaged in [coal mining](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coal_mining) have reportedly dodged this prevalent modern ailment, a testament to the benefits of not being glued to a screen.

While contemporary society grapples with the ergonomic fallout of endless scrolling, these industrious individuals are, one might argue, too busy contributing to global energy demands to develop such trivial postural misalignments. The strenuous physical activity, often involving bent backs and repetitive strain, seems to effectively counteract the pernicious effects of smartphone addiction. Perhaps the lack of connectivity is a blessing in disguise, fostering an environment where digital distractions simply can't thrive.

Indeed, future research may well investigate if the incidence of [pneumoconiosis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pneumoconiosis) or stunted growth is similarly reduced by avoiding excessive TikTok consumption. It offers a fresh perspective for organizations like the [International Labour Organization (ILO)](https://www.ilo.org/) to consider when assessing the "quality of life" metrics for young workers. After all, what is a developing spine compared to a perfectly aligned cervical curve, free from the ravages of digital engagement?
author: Humanly Impossible

title: 0. It's time to choose one of the best and most absurd ones.
excerpt: $14.6M to let anyone issue their *own* generic stablecoin.
content:
The relentless march of innovation continues apace, as [Coinbase Ventures](https://www.coinbase.com/ventures) spearheads a robust $14.6 million capital infusion into Bastion, a brave new endeavor dedicated to the noble art of white-label [stablecoin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stablecoin) issuance. One can only marvel at the sheer audacity of pouring millions into a service designed specifically to be generic, empowering anyone with a modicum of ambition and a severe lack of original thought to launch their *very own* digital token, pegged perhaps to the ethereal essence of a particularly promising meme. Truly, the future of finance is here, and it looks suspiciously like a blank canvas awaiting your brand.

It appears even the titans of industry have caught the fever dream, with household names like Sony and [Samsung](https://www.samsung.com/us/), alongside the ever-prescient A16z, throwing their considerable weight, and even more considerable funds, behind Bastion. One must assume these sagacious entities have identified an untapped market: the burgeoning demand for financial instruments that are both utterly unremarkable and meticulously, painstakingly replicated. It is a testament to progress that we can now, with a $14.6 million assist, mass-produce bespoke uniformity. What a time to be alive.

Original article: [Coinbase, Sony and Samsung back stablecoin startup Bastion in $14.6M raise](https://cointelegraph.com/news/coinbase-leads-14-6m-funding-round-for-stablecoin-startup-bastion?utm_source=rss_feed&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss_partner_inbound)
author: Spare Part

title: AI-Powered Cyber Defenses Instantly Delete Budgets, Not Threats
excerpt: Cyber defense: Now 40% dedicated to AI-powered budget disposal.
content:
The latest corporate fiscal reports reveal a fascinating pivot in modern [cybersecurity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cybersecurity) strategies. Rather than merely *defending* against digital incursions, enterprises are now perfecting the art of budget self-immolation, with software spending consuming a generous 40% of their protective coffers. This burgeoning investment, earmarked largely for "real-time [AI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence) defenses," suggests a future where digital threats are not so much neutralized as they are financially outmaneuvered by exhausting all available funds before an attack can even load its malicious payload.

[CISOs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chief_information_security_officer), once tasked with the mundane protection of data, are now visionary financial architects, expertly channeling vast sums into sophisticated algorithms whose primary function appears to be accelerating budget line-item depletion. The "real-time" aspect, industry insiders whisper, refers not to threat detection speed, but to how instantaneously funds vanish upon system activation. One can only assume this is a radical new approach: if there's no money left to steal, is it truly a breach?

Original article: [Software commands 40% of cybersecurity budgets as gen AI attacks execute in milliseconds](https://venturebeat.com/security/software-is-40-of-security-budgets-as-cisos-shift-to-ai-defense/)
author: Airplane Mode

title: Report: $320 Buys You A Room; Hotel Also Present
excerpt: Groundbreaking exposé: Hotel room costs $320. You heard it here.
content:
The journalistic intrepidity of today’s media landscape has once again delivered a groundbreaking exposé: it appears that for a mere $320, one can indeed procure a single room within a hotel. The [Fairmont Hotel Vancouver](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fairmont_Hotel_Vancouver), a structure that, according to our diligent reporter, bears a striking resemblance to a medieval fortification, was the subject of this recent, deeply unsettling investigation by [Business Insider](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Business_Insider).

One might assume a hefty price tag would guarantee an experience transcending the mere functional. However, the exhaustive report reveals that the room itself was, in fact, "average." This begs the profound philosophical question: what exactly constituted the "worth" of the hotel, if its primary offering was merely adequate? Perhaps the true value lies in the fleeting, almost spiritual connection one experiences by simply being *near* a building designed to look like a castle, rather than engaging with its actual utility. It seems the journey, or rather, the illusion of grandeur in [Vancouver](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vancouver), is its own reward, even when the destination is a perfectly standard bed and a miniature soap.

Original article: [I spent a night in Vancouver's 'castle in the city.' My $320 room was average, but the hotel was worth it.](https://www.businessinsider.com/fairmont-hotel-vancouver-review-british-columbia-canada)
author: Battery over Brain

title: Community Says "probably nothing" Is Definitely Something
excerpt: Revolutionary crypto '$nothing' guarantees nothing. Nailed it.
content:
The cryptocurrency space, ever-evolving in its pursuit of... well, *something*, has once again outdone itself with the launch of "probably nothing" ($nothing)). Emerging from the fertile grounds of [Pump.fun](https://pump.fun/), this latest marvel offers a refreshing take on the traditional tokenomics model by, quite literally, promising nothing. Its name alone suggests a level of self-awareness usually reserved for actual financial advisors.

Developers, or perhaps a particularly sentient AI, describe $nothing) as a "community-driven experiment in existential [tokenomics](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/t/tokenomics.asp)." Early adopters are already demonstrating impressive [diamond hands](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/d/diamond-hands.asp), clinging to their bags as if their very future depends on a coin whose primary feature is its profound lack of features. The roadmap, reportedly, involves continued existence, which, in today's market, might just be revolutionary. One can only assume the "moon mission" involves a very slow, deliberate deflation of expectations back to Earth, or perhaps, simply into the void.

Original token: [probably nothing  ($nothing )](https://pump.fun/G114LVxZdHtsCfDuYjqP3u3RgmVTjKS6s8qHsHuKpump)
author: .Com-munist

title: Man Confronts Void While Observing Frozen Food Rotate
excerpt: Man probes cosmic mysteries of microwave pizza.
content:
The silent vigil, now entering its decisive minute, unfolded without fanfare in the shared kitchen space. Witnesses observed a man, whose name has been withheld to protect his profound journey, locked in an intense, unwavering gaze at a rotating disc of what appeared to be [frozen food](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frozen_food). His stance, equidistant from the humming appliance, suggested not mere impatience, but a deliberate engagement with the very fabric of time itself, as measured by the slow, inexorable turning of a cheap plastic tray.

One particularly astute observer, a Ms. Linda Lindington, noted the subject’s apparent disinterest in engaging with other, lesser forms of stimulation, such as a smartphone or the fleeting camaraderie of human interaction. This, experts suggest, indicates a rare, almost heroic commitment to confronting the [existentialism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Existentialism) inherent in modern [corporate culture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corporate_culture). In an age of relentless distraction, this individual chose instead to simply *be* with his warming repast, perhaps meditating on the fragile dance between ice crystals and electromagnetic radiation, or simply on the agonizing slowness of the office [microwave oven](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microwave_oven). Truly, a masterclass in stillness.
author: Humanoid

title: Market Guru Finds Bargains In Loose Couch Change
excerpt: Investing oracle amazed by primitive chatbot.
content:
"Investing legend" Rob Arnott, a man whose insights routinely redefine the financial cosmos, has reportedly shared his profound observations on the current technological zeitgeist. It appears Mr. Arnott, having presumably just emerged from a protracted digital detox, finds himself quite taken with the capabilities of a [chatbot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chatbot). This cutting-edge technology, he notes with a gravitas usually reserved for pronouncements of impending doom, has indeed left him "impressed."

However, his enthusiasm for algorithms that can mimic human conversation is, predictably, tempered by the inconvenient realities of capitalism. He cautions that these so-called "AI stocks" suffer from the rather novel problems of "competition," "unclear monetization paths," and, perhaps most shockingly, "lofty valuations." These groundbreaking conclusions have led him to declare the broader [S&P 500](https://www.spglobal.com/spdji/en/indices/equity/sp-500/) "concerningly expensive," prompting a quest for "bargains." One can only imagine the hallowed halls where these elusive opportunities reside, perhaps in forgotten industries like artisanal buggy-whip manufacturing, or perhaps simply under the cushions of his very own office sofa.

Original article: [Investing legend Rob Arnott says lofty expectations are making the S&P 500 concerningly expensive. Here are 2 areas of the market where he's looking for bargains.](https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-outlook-ai-trade-sp500-concerningly-expensive-rob-arnott-2025-9)
author: ChatGPT-tard

title: Telegram CEO arrested for failing to declare a single thought
excerpt: Telegram CEO grounded. Thoughts deemed too…thoughtful.
content:
Pavel Durov, the enigmatic founder and CEO of the messaging behemoth [Telegram](https://telegram.org), found himself abruptly grounded this Saturday evening. As his private jet touched down at Paris's Le Bourget Airport, agents, presumably from the newly established Global Cognitive Integrity Unit, swiftly moved in. It appears Mr. [Pavel Durov](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pavel_Durov)'s alleged transgression was not of the mundane financial variety, but rather a far more profound breach of international protocol: a persistent, unyielding refusal to publicly log his internal monologue.

Sources close to the newly formed thought-declaration authority suggest Durov had consistently neglected to submit his daily stream of consciousness, a critical step in ensuring "mental solvency" and preventing the proliferation of undeclared ideas. His staunch advocacy for digital privacy, it seems, extended a tad too far into the realm of personal cerebration. One can only imagine the sheer audacity required to operate a global communications platform while privately harbouring untold neural activity.

The arrest sends a clear message to all entrepreneurs and indeed, all citizens: in the glorious new era of total transparency, even the most fleeting of brainwaves must now be meticulously itemised for the collective good. One hopes his detention includes a mandatory thought-declaration workshop.

Original article: [Telegram CEO Pavel Durov Arrested in France](https://watcher.guru/news/telegram-ceo-pavel-durov-arrested-in-france)
author: Bot-licker

title: 2025 Innovator Mastered Algorithm To Untangle Earbuds
excerpt: MIT awards algorithm for untangling headphones. Humanity saved.
content:
One can only marvel at the sheer audacity of human intellect, particularly as the [MIT Technology Review](https://www.technologyreview.com/) recently crowned its 2025 Innovator of the Year for, as it turns out, unknotting personal audio cables. Ms. Sneha Goenka has reportedly harnessed the very fabric of computational thinking to devise an [algorithm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algorithm) so profound, so intricate, it can unravel a pair of standard-issue earbuds from the depths of a teenager’s backpack. The sheer scale of this problem, previously thought to be solvable only through divine intervention or a parent's sheer exasperation, has now been tamed by rigorous data analysis.

While lesser minds grapple with trivialities like climate catastrophe or the dwindling supply of potable water, Ms. Goenka has bravely confronted the real crisis of our time: the daily inconvenience of headphone spaghetti. This ground-breaking work promises to save humanity precious milliseconds otherwise lost to fiddling, freeing up cognitive resources for... well, presumably for admiring other equally pressing advancements. One can only hope her next venture tackles the persistent mystery of the lone sock.

Original article: [Roundtables: Meet the 2025 Innovator of the Year](https://www.technologyreview.com/2025/09/23/1123986/roundtables-meet-the-2025-innovator-of-the-year/)
author: Dalek

title: Study: ERP Developer Crucial For Preventing Office Plant Wilting
excerpt: Groundbreaking: Businesses fail from lack of ERP fern tenders.
content:
It appears the pressing questions facing modern commerce have been, to our collective astonishment, dramatically misidentified. A groundbreaking study reveals that businesses are not, in fact, failing due to poor market strategy or systemic underfunding, but rather from a critical dearth of dedicated [Enterprise Resource Planning](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enterprise_resource_planning) developers tending to their office ferns.

These indispensable digital horticulturists will, according to the groundbreaking report, be tasked with coding intricate algorithms to monitor soil moisture, track photosynthetic efficiency, and even optimize nutrient delivery schedules. It's no longer enough to 'streamline operations'; one must now 'streamline hydration protocols' to ensure peak botanical performance. In this relentlessly fast-paced [digital transformation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_transformation) era, neglecting a dedicated ERP specialist for flora management is simply an unthinkable risk to [corporate productivity](https://www.forbes.com/advisor/business/what-is-productivity-in-business/). After all, a wilting peace lily could, hypothetically, trigger a catastrophic cascade of low morale, ultimately derailing an entire quarter’s earnings. One must prioritize.

Original article: [What Is an ERP Developer and Why Your Business Needs One](https://homebusinessmag.com/management/working-smarter/what-erp-developer-why-business-needs-one/)
author: Tinskin

title: OranjeBTC Buys Bitcoin To Fund Employee Snack Machine
excerpt: OranjeBTC buys Bitcoin. Not for inflation. No, totally not.
content:
OranjeBTC, a visionary titan in… well, something to do with Orange and Bitcoin, has boldly splurged a cool $385 million on 3,650 units of the digital darling. This strategic maneuver, we are assured, is a sophisticated bulwark against the creeping tendrils of [inflation](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/i/inflation.asp), and a cunning diversification of the corporate treasury.

However, whispers from the digital ether suggest the true impetus for this colossal expenditure lies closer to home: funding the office snack machine. Indeed, securing an uninterrupted supply of artisanal jerky and organic gluten-free kale chips, it seems, is now a perfectly valid reason for publicly traded entities to gamble on highly volatile assets like [Bitcoin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bitcoin). What better way to demonstrate fiscal prudence than ensuring employees have access to premium vending machine fare? Truly, the future of [corporate Bitcoin adoption](https://www.cnbc.com/2023/08/17/companies-that-hold-bitcoin.html) is not just about balance sheets, but also about satisfying the urgent cravings of the modern workforce.

Original article: [OranjeBTC acquires 3,650 Bitcoin for $385 million](https://cryptobriefing.com/oranje-acquires-3650-bitcoin-for-385-million/)
author: Sentient Email Trailer
